content.content: After spending a few months collecting feedbacks, questions/concerns, and evaluating the current process of the Ethereum mainnet upgrade, the EIPIP group recommended some changes to improve the Network Upgrade Process. I’ve drafted a blog explaining the new process. This will be shared on the Ethereum Cat Herders Medium to make it more accessible. @MadeofTin and I will be joining the All Core Devs meeting #100 to give a walkthrough (if time permits) and answer any questions.
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post is explaining the changes recommended by the EIPIP group to improve the Ethereum Network Upgrade Process. The author also mentions that they will be sharing a blog on the new process and joining a meeting to give a walkthrough and answer questions. A 3rd party may ask questions or give constructive criticism, and there is a possibility of collaboration.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
3rd party or author wants to collaborate on proposal

content.content: This looks awesome, thanks @poojaranjan!  I really like that the mainnet block number isn’t set until after the successful fork on the testnets, it makes the mainnet fork less a “fait accompli” and more something everyone can actually feel confident in.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
